alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 7:29PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Albany County through 815 PM MDT... At 729 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lake Hattie Reservoir, or 14 miles southwest of Laramie, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Albany County. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 287 and 311. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range
